column5: Great idea on the custom rod. REW is a rod builder, he posts on here occasionally. Pooch you are right there are many many things wrong with that idea. Soap may not do it need an industrial cleaner. Wmd
I think some time alone going across the lake with a large glass of whisky to meet that cute little 25 year old porn girl that you guys have snuck up, give him about 20 mins at the most.:
My apologies Pooch. Wedgie is quite the I never expected a simple request for gift ideas to take such a heinous turn. PjShorthorn

That is an awesome idea. I'm just not sure how much use it would get as he hasn't been a frequent fisherman over the years. He has heard me talk about Canada for 30 years and now actually has time to do it. I could always do the custom rod as a Christmas gift if he gets into fishing consistently. PjShorthorn
Hmmmmmm. What happens in camp stays in camp, right ? PjShorthorn
How bout some nice rain gear? Could come in pretty handy up here and can also be used outside of fishing.
Thongs...great idea!

"Now the thong idea is not too bad at all.....all newbies need some sort of initiation outside of just a nickname........."Your name is now Thonger. Why? Why not" You can take it a step further and make him wear the thong backwards.........................bet you can't get that visual out of your head now! Lol
I don't know him, haven't seen him, and I can't get that visual out of my head!!!Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk Pro

The first thing that comes to my mind would be a beginners sign making kit for the journey north. That way he can learn to feel more at home as he keeps up with his companion(s), learning the in's and out's of creative message media implementation. Bill
The backpack is an awesome idea for myself !!!! LOL Those sling backpacks are dang near hipster. Thanks for the suggestion. PjShorthorn
How much do those cute things go for ? I might need about 50 of them by June 21st.....all in XXXL. PjThonghorn
To your point Bill, I am planning on providing some OJT for many aspects that could be considered "communicative networking " while in camp. PjShorthorn
That is just so all wrong in so many ways....... I need to wash my eyes out with soap.Pooch

Have the rod custom built if you have time. Have his name, retirement date ect. put right on the rod. It's something he will cherish even after his fishing days are over. Do custom colors, colored thread, dress it up a bit.

My BIL has recently retired and is making his first trip to Canada with me this year. I have been trying to think of a retirement gift that he would enjoy and get some use out of. He has a nice set of clubs and bag since he is an avid golfer, he has his own humidor for his cigars, he has enough Green Bay Packer gear to embarrass most anyone ( plus I can't bring myself to buy that crap ),etc...... So I'm thinking about a nice ML action rod and reel combo that he can use on the trip and hopefully for trips to come. What other ideas do you folks have in the $200 range ? PjShorthorn
I think the rod/reel combo is a great idea.Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk Pro
Oh yeah...and a pink Walleye Central sticker PjShorthorn
Maybe one of Gords pink thongs? You know just for the kind of day when you want to feel the breeze! One of Breezy's boat urinals too!

Just bought my Fenwick Elite Tech Walleye rod for 150 based on the recommendations from many in this site. Great ML rod , can't wait to get some use out of it in a week. Sent from my SM-G935P using Tapatalk

Keep in mind I am talking in Cdn dollars so most likely cheaper in the US. I just bought a nice fenwick ml 7 foot rod and paired it w a shimano symetre from cabelas when they were clearing them out. All in about $225 Cdn and I love it. Also love that at that price point the fenwick has a limited lifetime warranty. CheersGordy
Edit. Rod was a Fenwick HMG

Now the thong idea is not too bad at all.....all newbies need some sort of initiation outside of just a nickname........."Your name is now Thonger. Why? Why not? " The Breezy Pee urinal I just can't do. The engineering defects haven't been worked out on how to keep the cap on the Clorox bottle. PjShorthorn
Maybe a little less expensive rod and reel combo, and a nice bottle of single malt Scotch that any good friend is sure to share with his best friend.

The rod and reel combo is a great idea. If the trip up to Canada is going to become a regular thing, you might consider one of the nice backpack tackle bags and load it up with a few of the necessities like needle nose pliers, a jaw spreader, etc. These bags are really nice, especially if you have to portage. You can even hide that thong in there somewhere. A few examples in the link immediately below.https://www.dickssportinggoods.com/p...-backpacks.jsp
